page.title: 20Truro - Cornwall's Centre 2
page.content: Cornwall's major private schools are in Truro, Truro School and the High School for Girls, these take boarders from all over the world. In recent years the shopping centre has been transformed by rebuilding and the arrival of some major chain stores as well as many smaller shops. Car parking unfortunately has not kept pace with the development, and there are often queues at peak periods, but there is a Park and Ride scheme. The Community Health Council has recently moved to St Austell, because of the parking problem. The Wednesday Cattle Market attracts many people, it has just moved to a new site outside the town, after outgrowing its old site on Castle Hill. A new BBC Local Radio station, Radio Cornwall, is based in the City, because of Truro's new and increasing importance in the County.
